content.raw: Yes, forward declaring should work with a weak pointer. We would then move `FrameSemantics.hh` into `src/` and make the integration test a unit test. I did a quick pass at it on the spec2_prototype_9 branch and it looks possible. We would also need to remove `GetPoseRelativeToGraph` from DOM objects.
content.html: Yes, forward declaring should work with a weak pointer. We would then move FrameSemantics.hh into src/ and make the integration test a unit test. I did a quick pass at it on the spec2_prototype_9 branch and it looks possible. We would also need to remove GetPoseRelativeToGraph from DOM objects.

pull_request.title: [Citadel] FrameSemantics API: add FrameAttachedToGraph and helper functions

pullrequest.title: [Citadel] FrameSemantics API: add FrameAttachedToGraph and helper functions

content.raw: I don't think so. We certainly add it to the map, so confirming that the count is not zero is more like an assert than an error to report. It also shouldn't have more than 1 entry, since `__model__` and `world` are reserved names. I wasn't sure, though so I included it. If it's not possible, then we won't be able to get any test coverage for it
content.html: I don't think so. We certainly add it to the map, so confirming that the count is not zero is more like an assert than an error to report. It also shouldn't have more than 1 entry, since __model__ and world are reserved names. I wasn't sure, though so I included it. If it's not possible, then we won't be able to get any test coverage for it

content.html: oh, I don't think it needs its own namespace. I think we can just adjust that comment

pull_request.title: [Citadel] FrameSemantics API: add FrameAttachedToGraph and helper functions

pullrequest.title: [Citadel] FrameSemantics API: add FrameAttachedToGraph and helper functions

content.raw:
I believe the types need to be public for the private methods that pass a weak pointer to the graphs, like `SetPoseRelativeToGraph(std::weak_ptr<const PoseRelativeToGraph>)`

we could forward declare a raw pointer and hide the implementation, but can we do that with a weak pointer? if so I would be open to hiding it from the public API, but I'm not sure that it's possible
content.html:
I believe the types need to be public for the private methods that pass a weak pointer to the graphs, like SetPoseRelativeToGraph(std::weak_ptr<const PoseRelativeToGraph>)

we could forward declare a raw pointer and hide the implementation, but can we do that with a weak pointer? if so I would be open to hiding it from the public API, but I'm not sure that it's possible
